item.title: 英国反垄断监管机构称赛峰集团的补救措施可能解决柯林斯交易的问题
item.description: 英国竞争监管机构周五表示，相信航空航天设备制造商赛峰集团提出的补救措施可以解决与该公司收购航空航天企业柯林斯公司部分股权有关的竞争问题。【原文：Britain's competition regulator said on Friday it believes that remedies offered by aerospace equipment manufacturer Safran could resolve competition concerns relating to its acquisition of a part of aerospace business Collins.】

item.title: 特朗普的最新关税威胁结束了印度医药股的短暂缓和期
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普威胁对印度医药行业征收高额关税后，印度医药股周五下跌 4.4%，抹去了上一交易日的涨幅。【原文：Indian pharmaceutical stocks fell 4.4% on Friday, wiping out gains from the previous session, after U.S. President Donald Trump threatened steep tariffs on the sector.】

item.title: 英国石油公司主席海尔格-伦德将在埃利奥特竞选活动中卸任
item.description: 英国石油公司周五表示，在激进对冲基金埃利奥特（Elliott）要求公司进行更多变革的运动中，英国石油公司董事长海尔格-伦德（Helge Lund）打算 "很可能在2026年 "卸任，挑选继任者的程序已经启动。【原文：BP Chair Helge Lund intends to step down "likely during 2026" and the process to pick his successor has started, BP said on Friday amid a campaign by activist hedge fund Elliott for more change at the company.】

item.title: 关税冲击之后，特朗普可能会利用金融武器对付盟友
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）最新一批关税措施的墨迹未干，一些人就已经开始为他下一步可能采取的行动做好准备。【原文：With the ink still fresh on U.S. President Donald Trump's latest batch of tariffs, some are already bracing for what may come next in his effort to strong-arm trading partners into doing his bidding.】

item.title: 关税引发对全球经济增长的担忧，日本银行股遭重挫
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税引发了对全球经济增长下滑的担忧，这可能会扼杀脆弱的经济复苏，并推迟世界第四大经济体的加息，日本银行股周五大幅下挫。【原文：Shares of Japanese banks plunged on Friday as U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs sparked fears of a downturn in global growth that could choke off a fragile recovery and delay rate increases in the world's fourth-largest economy.】

item.title: 税收打击迫在眉睫，英国雇主准备提高价格
item.description: 酒吧老板菲利普-索利（Philip Thorley）认为，一旦英国雇主下周开始增税，他的酒价只有一个方向：上涨。这对计划降低利率以帮助疲软经济的英国央行来说可能是个坏消息。【原文：Pub owner Philip Thorley sees only one direction for his prices once a tax hike for British employers kicks in next week: up. That may be bad news for the Bank of England, which plans to lower interest rates to help the sluggish economy.】

item.title: 欧洲 华尔街因失去信任而损失最大
item.description: 韦恩-科尔对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Wayne Cole】

item.title: 高盛因关税担忧和欧佩克+供应增加下调油价预期
item.description: 高盛将今年的布伦特原油均价预期下调了 5.5%，降至每桶 69 美元，将 WTI 原油均价预期下调了 4.3%，降至 66 美元，理由是欧佩克+供应增加和全球贸易战引发经济衰退的风险。【原文：Goldman Sachs lowered its forecast for Brent crude's average price this year by 5.5% to $69 a barrel and for WTI prices by 4.3% to $66, citing the risks of higher OPEC+ supply and the global trade war triggering a recession.】

item.title: 特朗普关税可能推迟日本加息，但不会使其脱轨
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）宣布的美国新关税措施可能会推迟但很可能不会破坏日本央行进一步加息的计划，因为日本央行的政策制定者们正努力避免日元再次下跌，以免加剧通胀压力。【原文：New U.S. tariffs announced by President Donald Trump may delay, but likely won't derail, the Bank of Japan's plan to raise interest rates further as policymakers seek to avoid renewed yen falls that would worsen inflationary pressures.】

item.title: 预计 3 月份美国就业增长缓慢而稳定
item.description: 美国 3 月份的就业增长可能放缓，原因是公共部门为削减联邦政府开支而大量解雇员工，而企业也不愿增加招聘，因为进口关税已危及经济健康。【原文：U.S. job growth likely slowed in March amid mass firings of public sector workers to slash federal government spending and reluctance by businesses to increase hiring because of import tariffs that have put the economy's health in peril.】

item.title: 布鲁克菲尔德公司将以约 90 亿美元（包括债务）收购 Colonial 管道公司
item.description: 布鲁克菲尔德基础设施合伙公司（Brookfield Infrastructure Partners）周四表示，该公司将收购美国最大的燃料运输系统殖民管道公司（Colonial Pipeline），包括债务在内的交易价值约为 90 亿美元。【原文：Brookfield Infrastructure Partners is buying Colonial Pipeline, the largest U.S. fuel transportation system, in a deal valued at about $9 billion, including debt, the company said on Thursday.】

item.title: 澳大利亚证券交易所再次面临投资者对双类别上市计划的抵制
item.description: 澳大利亚计划引入双层股票交易，以帮助重振其疲软的上市市场，但这一计划面临着投资者的抵制，他们担心这种结构会赋予包括创始人在内的一些股东过多的权力。【原文：Australia's plan to introduce dual-class share trading to help revive its weak listing market faces resistance from investors concerned the structure would give too much power to some shareholders, including founders.】

item.title: 特朗普征收新关税，石油将迎来数月来最糟糕的一周
item.description: 周五亚市早盘，油价进一步下跌，因美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）征收新关税，油价有望创下数月来最糟糕的一周，这激起了人们对全球贸易战可能拖累石油需求的担忧。【原文：Oil prices fell further in early Asian trade on Friday, and were on track for the worst week in months over U.S. President Donald Trump's new tariffs, stoking concerns over a global trade war that could weigh on oil demand.】

item.title: 美国就业报告发布前，交易员评估关税影响，美元走势脆弱
item.description: 周五，美元努力重新站稳脚跟，避险日元在六个月高位附近徘徊，交易员们在评估唐纳德-特朗普总统咄咄逼人、影响深远的新关税措施的后果。【原文：The U.S. dollar struggled to regain its footing with the safe-haven yen hovering near a six-month peak on Friday, as traders took stock of the fallout from President Donald Trump's aggressive and far-reaching new tariff measures.】

item.title: 部长表示，沃尔沃将把墨西哥工厂的投资额提高到 10 亿美元
item.description: 墨西哥经济部长马塞洛-埃布拉德（Marcelo Ebrard）周四表示，瑞典 AB 沃尔沃公司将把其在墨西哥新莱昂州新建的北美重型卡车工厂的投资额从之前宣布的 7 亿美元增加到 10 亿美元。【原文：Sweden's AB Volvo will increase its investment in its new North American heavy-duty truck factory in Nuevo Leon, Mexico, from a previously announced $700 million to $1 billion, Mexico's Economy Minister Marcelo Ebrard said on Thursday.】

item.title: 媒体报道称，澳大利亚多家养老基金遭遇黑客协同攻击
item.description: 据当地媒体周五报道，澳大利亚多家养老基金遭到黑客协同攻击，数千个成员账户被泄露。【原文：Multiple Australian pension funds have been hit by coordinated hacking that compromised thousands of member accounts, local media reported on Friday.】

item.title: 特朗普关税引发经济衰退担忧，股市受挫，美元下跌
item.description: 由于投资者担心美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的全面关税措施会使全球经济陷入衰退，周五股市在本周结束时一蹶不振，美元将迎来一个月来最糟糕的一周，而黄金则徘徊在历史最高点。【原文：Stocks limped to the end of the week on Friday, the dollar was set for its worst week in a month while gold flirted with a record peak as investors feared U.S. President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs would tip the global economy into a recession.】

item.title: 日本股市暴跌，银行因关税担忧而下滑
item.description: 由于市场担心美国总统唐纳德-特朗普全面征收关税会导致全球经济衰退，日本股市周五下跌至去年8月以来的最低水平，并将创下五年来的最大单周跌幅。【原文：Japanese stocks sank on Friday to their lowest levels since last August, and were set for their sharpest weekly drop in five years, as fears of a global recession in the wake of U.S. President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs gripped markets.】

item.title: 全球工会组织称，航空公司飞行员需要能够自由表达安全关切
item.description: 国际航线飞行员协会联合会（IFALPA）负责人表示，飞行员需要更好地自由表达安全关切，而不必担心受到惩罚，以减少航空事故的发生几率。【原文：Pilots need to be better able to voice safety concerns freely without fear of punishment to reduce the chances of aviation accidents, the head of the International Federation of Air Line Pilots' Associations (IFALPA) said.】

item.title: 随着马斯克的反弹日益加剧，特斯拉投资者担心特斯拉今年的销量将再次下滑
item.description: 在 2024 年特斯拉的销量首次出现下滑之后，公司首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）承诺特斯拉将在今年恢复增长。但现在看来，他的胜算不大。【原文：CEO Elon Musk pledged Tesla would return to growth this year after the company posted its first-ever sales decline in 2024. But the odds look stacked against him.】

item.title: 独家消息消息人士称摩根士丹利为日本房地产基金筹资约 6.8 亿美元
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的人士透露，摩根士丹利正在为一只专注于日本的房地产基金募集约 1,000 亿日元（合 6.84 亿美元）的资金，这凸显了投资者对房地产的兴趣，因为这个世界第四大经济体正在走出多年的通货紧缩和价格停滞。【原文：Morgan Stanley is raising about 100 billion yen ($684 million) for a Japan-focused real estate fund, two people familiar with the matter said, highlighting investor interest in property as the world's fourth-largest economy emerges from years of deflation and standstill prices.】

item.title: 特朗普加征关税后，日产汽车将暂停在美国订购墨西哥制造的英菲尼迪 SUV
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）征收的新汽车关税生效后，日产汽车公司（Nissan Motor）周四表示，将停止向美国市场订购两款墨西哥制造的英菲尼迪越野车。【原文：Nissan Motor said on Thursday it will halt new orders of two Mexican-built Infiniti SUVs for the U.S. market after new auto tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump took effect.】

item.title: 特朗普政府就中国进口关税提起诉讼
item.description: 保守派法律团体新公民自由联盟（New Civil Liberties Alliance）周四提起诉讼，称这是第一起寻求阻止唐纳德-特朗普对中国进口商品征收关税的诉讼，称美国总统越权。【原文：New Civil Liberties Alliance, a conservative legal group, on Thursday filed what it said was the first lawsuit seeking to block Donald Trump's tariffs on Chinese imports, saying the U.S. president overstepped his authority.】

item.title: 摩根大通警告说，特朗普的关税是自 1968 年以来美国最大的一次增税行动
item.description: 摩根大通（JPMorgan）的一份报告指出，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普累计加征的关税约为22%，相当于美国自1968年以来最大的一次增税。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump's cumulative tariff hikes amount to about 22%, which would be equivalent to the biggest U.S. tax increase since 1968, according to a note from JPMorgan.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）总裁格奥尔基耶娃称美国关税对全球前景构成重大风险
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）总裁周四发表声明称，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周三宣布的全面关税措施在全球经济增长疲软之际对全球经济构成了重大风险。【原文：Sweeping tariffs announced on Wednesday by U.S. President Donald Trump represent a significant risk to the global economy at a time when growth has been sluggish, the head of the International Monetary Fund said in a statement on Thursday.】

item.title: 在激烈的澳大利亚大选中，一款中国应用程序可能会起到决定性作用
item.description: 工党的杰罗姆-拉克萨勒（Jerome Laxale）在 2022 年大选中从自由党手中赢得了悉尼本内隆（Bennelong）选区的席位。【原文：When the Labor Party's Jerome Laxale won the Sydney seat of Bennelong from the Liberals at the 2022 election, votes from Chinese Australians angry about then-prime minister Scott Morrison's spat with Beijing were instrumental in his victory.】

item.title: 葛兰素史克与辉瑞就 RSV 疫苗的专利诉讼达成和解
item.description: 据特拉华州联邦法院周四的一份文件显示，英国制药巨头葛兰素史克公司和竞争对手辉瑞公司已同意结束一项诉讼，该诉讼指控辉瑞公司的呼吸道合胞病毒（RSV）疫苗Abrysvo侵犯了葛兰素史克公司在其竞争性RSV疫苗Arexvy上的专利权。【原文：British pharmaceutical giant GlaxoSmithKline and rival Pfizer have agreed to end a lawsuit that alleged Pfizer's respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) vaccine Abrysvo violated GSK's patent rights in its competing RSV shot Arexvy, according to a Thursday filing in Delaware federal court.】

item.title: 美国联合航空公司波音航班客舱起火，联邦航空局将展开调查
item.description: 美国联合航空公司一架从佛罗里达飞往纽瓦克机场的波音737航班上的机组人员报告机舱内起火，美国联邦航空管理局周四表示将对此展开调查。【原文：The U.S. Federal Aviation Administration on Thursday said it will investigate after the crew on a United Airlines-operated Boeing 737 flight from Florida to Newark airport reported a fire in the cabin.】

item.title: AppLovin 竞购中国以外所有市场的 TikTok
item.description: 营销平台 AppLovin 周四表示，在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普规定的为 1.7 亿美国人使用的短视频应用寻找非中国买家的 4 月 5 日最后期限到来之前，它已提交了一份对 TikTok 在中国以外资产的竞购书。【原文：Marketing platform AppLovin said on Thursday it has submitted a bid for TikTok assets outside of China, ahead of the April 5 deadline set by the U.S. President Donald Trump to find a non-Chinese buyer for the short video app used by 170 million Americans.】

item.title: 独家：消息人士称，海莉-比伯正在探索出售其彩妆品牌 Rhode
item.description: 据三位熟知内情的人士透露，名模海莉-比伯（Hailey Bieber）正在探索出售其彩妆品牌 Rhode，价值可能超过 10 亿美元。【原文：Model Hailey Bieber is exploring a sale of her makeup brand Rhode that could be worth more than $1 billion, according to three people familiar with the matter.】
